reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A perfect book!
reviews.reviewText: After we tore through "Barb the Last Berserker," we were looking for another epic, hilarious book that both the adults and our seven year old would love. This is that book. It is so funny, so epic, and the characters are delightful. The only complaint I have is that we stayed up late reading every night because we just couldn't put it down! This book is a 10/10, and I can't wait to read the next installment.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars My 9 yr old loves this book
reviews.reviewText: Great story, easy for my kid to read and he enjoys the story a lot.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great choice for reluctant readers
reviews.reviewText: A certain 7-year-old boy loved this book. As a librarian, I’ve noticed that active boisterous kids (ie. boys, but also some girls) need bright, colorful, humorous, action-filled books to draw them in and build a practice of reading. Graphic novels for young readers are a great choice.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fun for all ages
reviews.reviewText: My seven year old loves graphic novels and comics and this might be his favorite so far. Seems like I catch him re-reading it every other day since we’ve had it. Looking forward to the sequel!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 10, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Cat-stronaut on the moon
reviews.reviewText: What do you get when you take the best-selling author Mac Barnett, the Caldecott Honor award-winning illustrator Shawn Harris, and let them work on a project together while everyone is sheltering in place during 2020? A live-action cartoon featuring the first cat in space, of course! And after the episodes have received thousands of views - the mandate of the people is that the story must be made into a graphic novel of epic adventure! At long last that project is coming to store shelves and online retailers so that we can all enjoy it even when the Internet is down.After astronomers discover that rats are actually eating the moon, a top secret mission launches the first cat in space to solve the problem. Accompanied by a toenail-clipping robot and the queen of the moon, our intrepid hero must face rats from another galaxy and all the dangers inside their secret base on the dark side of the moon. The hearty adventurers travel through the Land of Frost and the Peninsula of Thunder, meet the man in the moon and a three-headed rat king, and make allies and enemies along the way. But with only three days to save the moon, will they succeed?Fans of Dog Man, The Flying Beaver Brothers, and similar humorous graphic novels for middle grade readers will have a new favorite book to read and talk over with friends. The commander at Earth's Hexagon (military headquarters) comes up with silly phrases such as, "Oh my grammy's meat loaf" or "Oh my wrinkly pinkie toe" and his assistant Dr.Milksop always says, "My thoughts exactly, sir." His outbursts remind me of Stone Rabbit exclaiming, "Crud monkeys!"Once readers reach the end of the book, they may enjoy having a watch party of the live cartoon episodes to see where the story began. And there are hints that a second book may happen. "Oh my mama llama."

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars My 10 year old son and I loved this
reviews.reviewText: We checked this out after having a lot of fun with Mac Barnett's Terrible Two series. It's really great-- fast-moving, actual laughs, and a satisfying ending. Highly recommend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A Hit With the Grands
reviews.reviewText: I pre-ordered this for my 6 year old GS based on the Amazon description. It was a hit and he asked that I get the next one when it is available. He said it was goofy and fun.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Reluctant reader likes it
reviews.reviewText: My 7 year old doesn’t read much for fun yet, but thought this was a good one.
My daughter watched the YouTube version of this, and she said she had to have the book! Another great story from Mac Barnett!
